results.title: It need not happen
results.brief_description: A report on the statistics of road accidents and the measures that are being taken to improve the safety of the roads. The film maintains that, by exercising care in the use of the roads, the public can co-operate in making them safe.
results.description: A report on the statistics of road accidents and the measures that are being taken to improve the safety of the roads. The film maintains that, by exercising care in the use of the roads, the public can co-operate in making them safe.

results.title: It might be you
results.brief_description: A number of people leave their respective homes by car, bicycle and on foot; they all just manage to avoid accidents until they all arrive at the same stretch of road and collide. Some of the people in the film escape unharmed - others don’t. This is a road safety film with a difference. Features Peter Cushing.

results.title: It is called New Zealand
results.brief_description: Proving that a country needn’t be stuffy when showing itself off. This film is a total impression of the nation - a montage of picture and sound that needs no spoken commentary.

results.title: It happened here again
results.brief_description: A look at the making of “Winstanley”, a low budget feature film by independent filmmakers Kevin Brownlow and Arthur Mollo. Shows the search for actors, locations and money for this adaptation of a period from 17th century British history, concerned with the setting up of a commune by Winstanley, a man with a socialist vision. As well, Brownlow and Mollo talk of their beginnings in the film industry and their other film ventures. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: It happened here
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Kevin Brownlow and Andrew Mollo
results.brief_description: This is an imaginative realisation of a German occupation of Britain in July, 1940: Pauline Murray, an Irish girl working in England, joins up in 1944 with the re-emerging Resistance. On a 7,000 pound budget the filmmakers’ recreated a newsreel style but did not use stock or newsreel footage, a direct reaction to fifties war movies which they felt never dealt with the nature of Nazism. A controversial sequence showed real British Nazis expressing their beliefs. The documentary style drama took eight years to complete.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United Artists Corporation, Kevin Brownlow and Andrew Mollo

results.title: It doesn't hurt to know
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions, Eve Ash and Ted Robinson
results.brief_description: Discusses the symptoms, causes and prevention of P.I.D. - Pelvic Inflammatory Disease, a sexually transmitted infection causing infertility in young women. Stresses the importance of check-ups, the use of condoms and honest communication between partners.

results.title: It didn't have to happen
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the careless worker who scorns safety devices on modern machinery endangers not only his own life but the lives of fellow workers. It portrays a careless employee and the tragic result of his slipshod methods. Designed to show employers in industry why guards are put on machines and how they should be used.

results.title: It couldn't happen
results.brief_description: Burns are one of the most frequent types of domestic accidents, particularly to children. The variety of situations in which accidental burning can happen are explored, the elements that are involved and how they can be minimised. In particular, it details the importance of the material in, and the design of children’s clothes.
